discourse_list.title: Signal Request: Reduce the PAXUSD-A Collateralization Ratio

content.content: Now that we have some other stablecoin collateral types and have recently concluded a SR for reducing USDC-A, I thought it might be good to see if the community would be willing to reduce other stablecoins to help with adoption/reducing the peg. Since PAXUSD vault is at 120% liquidation ratio and USDC-A is at 110% I doubt the PAX vault will see much usage. Therefore I ask the community to participate in the following poll: What should the PAXUSD-A Collateralization Ratio be?     120% (No change) 110% 105% 102.5% 101% Abstain     0 voters     Poll will end 2020-09-15T04:00:00Z. If passed, a pull request on github will be created to add an on-chain governance poll to the following week’s governance cycle.
content.GPT-summary: The author of the post is proposing to reduce the collateralization ratio of the PAXUSD-A vault and is asking for feedback from the community through a poll. The post explains the reasoning behind the proposal and provides options for the community to vote on. A 3rd party could give constructive criticism or ask questions about the proposal.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is asking for feedback
Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: So far: PAX 101%, USDC 105%, DAI $1.029. Does that make sense? I voted for no change because I think there will be no change whichever option wins.
I completely forgot about this poll lol. Obviously this has been overridden and so I am closing this thread.
